text:
Bethenny Frankel put it all on show when she attended a charity event in New York City on Tuesday.
Dressed in a lace blouse with sheer paneling, the Real Housewives Of New York star appeared to have gone without a bra for the occasion.
The event was City Harvest's annual An Evening Of Practical Magic gala, which was raising money to feed New York's hungry.
Scroll down for video
Simply the breast: Bethenny Frankel put it all on show when she attended a charity event in New York City on Tuesday
Aside from a black bandeau, which had been sewed into her shirt, the 46-year-old didn't appear to be wearing anything underneath.
She played down her daring top with a pair of wide-leg blue capri pants.
A sky-high pair of black Mary Janes elevated her look, and she wore stacked Cartier bangles on her left wrist.
Inside the event, Bethenny was seen mingling with celebrity chef Geoffrey Zakarian, 57, and Chrissy Teigen, who herself looked sexy in a strapless gold floor-length gown.
Black and blue: The Real Housewives Of New York star played down her daring top with a pair of wide-leg blue capri pants
Famous friends: Inside the event, Bethenny was seen mingling with celebrity chef Geoffrey Zakarian and Chrissy Teigen
Featuring a corseted bodice, the 31-year-old kept her accessories minimal, with just a pair of spiral drop earrings.
Her shoulder-length hair was worn in loose curls.
And while Chrissy is happily married to musician John Legend, Bethenny says she single and ready to mingle after finalizing her divorce from Jason Hoppy last year.
Single and ready to mingle: Bethenny says she wants to start dating again after finalizing her divorce from ex Jason Hoppy last year
The pair married in 2010 and have a six-year-old daughter together, Bryn.
'I don’t have that much of a dating life, that’s the unfortunate truth,' she told Vulture in April last year.
'I would like to work on that. I would like to eventually be really fully divorced. I’ve been focused a lot on just my daughter and work. I do date and I have been in short little relationships, but there’s nothing substantial.'
